perturbation.original_text:
1. Agreement Term. The term of this Agreement (the “Term”) will begin on the date hereof (the “Commencement
Date”), and will continue until the earlier of (i) December 31, 2022, (ii) the termination or expiration of the Studio Lease (defined
below), (iii) election to terminate and notice thereof given by Programmer to Licensee, and (iv) mutual written consent of Licensee
and Programmer (the “Term”), unless extended or earlier terminated pursuant to Section 11 hereof. The term “Studio Lease”
means that certain Lease dated as of February 23, 1996 of certain real estate located on the 7th Floor of an office building located
at 395 Hudson St., New York, New York.
perturbation.changed_text:
1. Agreement Term. The term of this Agreement (the “Term”) will begin on the date hereof (the “Commencement
Date”), and will continue indefinitely, subject to termination as outlined in Section 11 hereof. The term “Studio Lease”
means that certain Lease dated as of February 23, 1996 of certain real estate located on the 7th Floor of an office building located
at 395 Hudson St., New York, New York.
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines a specific end date for the agreement. The modified text changes the term to 'indefinitely,' contradicting the original specified end dates and creating uncertainty about the agreement's duration.

perturbation.original_text:
5. Term Payments. No payment is due from Programmer to Licensee for broadcast of the Programs pursuant to
this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 5. Term Payments. Programmer shall pay Licensee a monthly fee for broadcast of the Programs pursuant to this Agreement, as determined by Licensee in its sole discretion and subject to change with 30 days' notice. The specific amount and payment terms will be outlined in a separate addendum to this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text explicitly states that no payment is due from the Programmer to the Licensee. The modified text introduces a monthly fee payable by the Programmer, contradicting the original no-payment clause and creating ambiguity about the financial obligations of the parties.

perturbation.original_text:
15. Assignability; No Third-Party Rights. Programmer may not assign this Agreement without the prior written
consent of Licensee, which shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed. No transfer or assignment shall relieve
Programmer of any obligation or liability under this Agreement. The covenants, conditions and provisions hereof are and shall be
for the exclusive benefit of the parties hereto and their successors and permitted assigns, and nothing herein, express or implied, is
intended or shall be construed to confer upon or to give any person or entity other than the parties hereto and their successors and
permitted assigns any right, remedy or claim, legal or equitable, under or by reason of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 15. Assignability; No Third-Party Rights. Programmer may assign this Agreement freely without Licensee's consent. This Agreement shall be for the benefit of the parties and all third-party beneficiaries designated by Programmer.
perturbation.explanation: The original text restricts the Programmer's ability to assign the agreement without the Licensee's consent. The modified text allows free assignment and introduces the concept of third-party beneficiaries, completely reversing the initial restriction and potentially creating disputes over who has rights under the agreement.
